question: A historian would most likely use the image in  <image 1> as support for which of the following?
options: ['Defensive walls were successful in preventing borderland nomads from conquering the Han dynasty.', 'The Han government built fortifications to protect the Silk Road.', 'Monumental architecture served both a religious and a military purpose in the Qin and Han dynasties.', 'Fortifications were built to project military power and defend against invasions.']
description: The image depicts a section of the Great Wall of China, showcasing its winding path along rugged terrain. The wall is constructed with large stone blocks and features watchtowers at regular intervals. The landscape surrounding the wall is mountainous, with dense vegetation covering the slopes. The sky above is partly cloudy, adding to the dramatic and historical atmosphere of the scene. The text above the image provides context, stating that the Great Wall was first built around 220 B.C.E. and extended by successive dynasties.
